Organs/Tissues: Human heart (ventricular cardiomyocytes in aligned 2D monolayer)
Physiological/Pathological: Both – healthy iPSC-CMs or disease (patient iPSC lines)
Cell Source: Human iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes (± fibroblasts), on nanopatterned plates
Stromal Cells: No by default, can add fibroblasts
Extracellular Matrix: Yes (nano-patterned substrate that mimics ECM topography)
Notable Features: Enhanced cardiac maturity via nanopattern, high-throughput in 96/384-well plates, MEA or Ca2+ imaging possible
Max Culture Duration: Weeks to months with specialized media
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes (calcium flux, morphology, contractility by video)
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Yes (IF on monolayer, no thick tissue to embed)
Readouts - MEA: Yes, can combine with MEA plates
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Possible electrical pacing or stretch (via external devices), no flow
model_availability: Product (NanoSurface plates, iPSC-CMs) & Service (Curi’s CRO studies)

Physiological/Pathological: Both – healthy or disease (cardiomyopathy, etc.) from iPSC lines
Cell Source: Human iPSC-derived cardiomyocytes (± fibroblasts) in fibrin/hydrogel
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, mostly CM + optional supporting cells
3D Scaffold: Yes (engineered 3D tissue anchored between flexible posts)
Notable Features: Real-time contractile force readout (magnetic sensor), up to 24 tissues in Mantarray plate, electrical pacing for maturation
Max Culture Duration: Weeks to months, stable function with specialized media
Readouts - Live Imaging: Possible, but main readout is label-free force measurement
Readouts - MEA: No direct MEA; optical mapping or force sensors used
Readouts - Integrated Biosensors: Yes (magnetic contractility sensor integrated in Mantarray)
model_availability: Product (Mantarray system & plates) & Service (CRO for 3D EHT assays)

Organs/Tissues: Human skeletal muscle (aligned myotubes in monolayer)
Physiological/Pathological: Both – healthy or muscle disease (e.g. DMD) from iPSC lines
Cell Source: Human iPSC-derived myoblasts → aligned myotubes on NanoSurface plates
Multiple Cell Types: Primarily myotubes, can add fibroblasts if desired
Notable Features: Aligned skeletal myotubes for contractility assays, high-throughput in 96/384 wells
Plate/Format (Throughput): NanoSurface plates, up to 384-well format (high throughput)
Readouts - MEA: No (usually force by video or external electrodes for stimulation)
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Electrical/ mechanical stim possible with external device, no flow
model_availability: Product (NanoSurface plates, iPSC muscle) & Service (CRO assays)

Physiological/Pathological: Both – normal or diseased (e.g. DMD, myopathies) from iPSC lines
Cell Source: iPSC-derived myoblasts in 3D hydrogel (± neuronal co-culture for NMJ)
Multiple Cell Types: Yes (myocytes ± fibroblasts, ± motor neurons for NMJ)
3D Scaffold: Yes (tissue cast in gel between posts)
Notable Features: Measures contractile force real-time (magnetic sensor), can form functional NMJ with motor neurons, 24-well plate
Readouts - Live Imaging: Limited, main readout is force sensor, optional confocal at endpoint
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Electrical stimulation protocols, no fluid flow
model_availability: Product (Mantarray system & plates) & Service (CRO for muscle assays)
